issue.title: libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so: undefined symbol on Ubuntu 12.04 since 2014/01/21

content.raw:
I assume that the problem is happening using ROS + OSRF repositories. In that case, we will need a rebuild, yes. Looks the same that [one reported in answers.gazebosim.org](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/5302/hydro-gazebo-undefined-symbol-after-update/).

I thought that ROS does not allow ABI breakages when a distribution is in use. @tfoote what is the policy for this kind of changes? The ABI should be kept stable only for system dependencies not for ROS packages?
content.html:
I assume that the problem is happening using ROS + OSRF repositories. In that case, we will need a rebuild, yes. Looks the same that one reported in answers.gazebosim.org.

I thought that ROS does not allow ABI breakages when a distribution is in use. @tfoote what is the policy for this kind of changes? The ABI should be kept stable only for system dependencies not for ROS packages?
